answers.answer: Night sweats can be caused by numerous things such as: hypoglycemia, diabetes, female hormone issues, menopause, etc. Have you had all these rulled out?  Have you ever checked your sugar levels during the night when this happens? I would do that just to rule it out. You can have your Dr test your female hormones as well.The acid reflux is a different monster....keep up with your meds and ask for something different if it isn't working. Keep trying. I would also suggest digestive enzymes with your meals. You can find them at any of your local health food stores.The incision and stitch area will take a little time to heal and yes it will take a while to regain all your sensation there. :)Hope you keep healing and feeling better! :)

question: 13 days op.- lobectomy for enlarged goitre.  The breathing probs i had pre op because of compression issues resolved straight away.  Two things that have not resolved.  One - night sweats - still driving me crazy because I get a disturbed nights sleep and am sure that is why i am still weepy and irritable.  When does that resolve or doesn't it?   Secondly - i had probs with indigestion pre op and started on omeprazole by my GP.  It was expected that that too would resolve post op when there was no longer any coimpression from the goitre.  Instead of which it is worse than ever.  I don't seem to be having the same intensity of burning pain but i am constantly burping and regurgitating mainly fluid into my mouth.  Is this common?   The final problem is lack of sensation in the skin around the stitch line but also under my chin    Why is that and how long before it is back to normal?
title: 13 days post op
